programme.title: UFC 303: Pereira vs. Proch√°zka - Prelims
programme.desc: Payton Talbott vs. Yanis Ghemmouri, bantamweight; Charles Jourdain vs. Jean Silva, featherweight; Cub Swanson vs. Andre Fili, featherweight, Joe Pyfer vs. Marc-Andre Barriault, middleweight. From T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From James L. Knight Center in Miami.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Formula 1 Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Featuring pre-race predictions and analysis leading up to today's Formula 1 racing action.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Max Verstappen runs hot into Red Bull's home race as the Austrian Grand Prix revs up. Verstappen has won three of the last four events despite a shrinking gap to the rest of the grid, and became the first four-time winner in Austria in 2023.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Liberty return to action against the Dream. New York's bid for back-to-back Commissioner's Cup titles was foiled by Minnesota on June 25. New York has won seven of the last eight meetings with Atlanta after taking two in Georgia earlier in June.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Caitlin Clark road show continues as her Fever visit the Valley of the Sun to play the Mercury. The clubs split four meetings last season with each winning once at home. Diana Taurasi (PHO) averaged 17.5 points in that quartet of contests.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo P√©rez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Cole Irvin's Orioles host the Rangers. Irvin was 6-2 with a 2.87 ERA before going 0-2 and yielding 17 runs (12 earned) in 14 1/3 innings over his last three outings. Austin Hays (BAL) is 4-for-10 with two home runs versus Texas starter Andrew Heaney.

programme.title: 2024 Wimbledon Championships
programme.desc: From the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in Wimbledon, England.

programme.title: Wimbledon - Second Serve
programme.desc: Highlights, analysis and previews of tennis action from Wimbledon.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: On June 15, 2011, Vancouver hosts Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals between the Canucks and Boston Bruins; the city is a hive of nervous energy with the home team on the verge of its first-ever title, but when Boston stuns the Canucks to win the Cup, the situation quickly devolves into a full-blown riot, an orgy of violence that sees cars overturned and burned, windows shattered, businesses looted, and lawlessness reign... as hundreds of cell phone cameras capture it all.

programme.title: X Games Ventura 2024
programme.desc: From Ventura, Calif.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the St. Louis Cardinals' Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs' Sammy Sosa embark on a chase of one of the game's most hallowed records, igniting the passion and imagination of fans and non-fans everywhere.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Gotham FC (8-3-3) end a three-game run at home by hosting the Reign (2-9-3). Gotham's five-match win streak was halted by a second 2-0 defeat to Washington this year on June 23. Seattle lost the last two 2023 clashes to Gotham by a combined 6-1 line.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds' relentless battle to clear his name reveals systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete's legacy. As the documentary makes clear, the real truth is found beyond the headlines.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds' relentless battle to clear his name reveals systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete's legacy. As the documentary makes clear, the real truth is found beyond the headlines.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Tyrese Haliburton had 27 points and 15 assists as the Pacers beat the Bucks, 128-119, to advance to the championship game in the NBA's In-Season Tournament. Giannis Antetokounmpo had 37 points and 10 rebounds to lead Milwaukee. From Dec. 7, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: LeBron James scored 30 points in less than three quarters as the Lakers steamrolled the Pelicans, 133-89, to reach the championship game in the NBA In-Season Tournament. Trey Murphy III led the Pelicans with 14 points. From Dec. 7, 2023.
